newsitem.title: USA: Japan confident in economic recovery -- Kato.
newsitem.headline: Japan confident in economic recovery -- Kato.

text.p: Takatoshi Kato, Japan's Vice Finance Minister for international affairs, said on Sunday that Japan is confident in the current situation of the Japanese economy.
Asked about short-term measures to reduce Japan's external surplus, Kato told Reuters Financial Television that private demand in Japan is strong enough to sustain current economic recovery.
"We are confident about the current basis of Japan's economic recovery," Kato said.
He said Japan does not expect its external surplus to increase significantly in the medium term.
He was commenting on an economic statement released on Saturday by the leaders of the Group of Seven industrial nations.
The statement stipulated that Japan has the objective of achieving strong domestic demand-led growth and avoiding a significant increase in its external surplus.
Kato said the statement should not be taken as a demand by the G7 countries for Japan's increased efforts to expand domestic demand. He said that was the objective set by Japan.
